pullRequest.title: [#10874] Migrate CI to Github Actions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Part of #10874
This PR adds a new workflow file to launch a Github Action for our CI testing. Tests have been added for both windows/ubuntu. Once successful, we can proceed to remove our appveyor/travis dependancy.
Changelog

Modified AppPage.java: Updated getSelectedDropdownOptionText method to wait for dropdown text before fetching the selected option

Remarks

Looks like certain tests still fail periodically (it is not a 100% guaranteed success)

TODO:

 Ensure E2E tests pass more reliably
 Remove .travis.yml and appveyor.yml (along with the property files)
 Separate into multiple workflow files to allow for triggering of jobs manually
 Check if coveralls is working

commit.message: Update temporary branch for testing action
Try increase timeout to prevent tests from failing
Update InstructorFeedbackSessionsPage new session panel lookup
upload to codecov only on ubuntu + remove bash shell req
update branches to run action on
wait for text to load in dropdown before finding

nodes.bodyText: The purpose of separating this step in Travis is such that the first stage can be cached. Without that, there is no reason to explicitly call this because Gradle includes downloading dependencies within its build step.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,141 @@
+name: Continous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Cache NPM packages 
+        uses: actions/cache@v2 
+        with:
+          path: ~/.npm
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-
+      - name: Install Backend Dependancies 
+        run: ./gradlew downloadDependencies downloadTestDependencies downloadLinters

nodes.bodyText: No use doing this because npm ci doesn't care about caches
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: This can be combined with the previous step?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,141 @@
+name: Continous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Cache NPM packages 
+        uses: actions/cache@v2 
+        with:
+          path: ~/.npm
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-
+      - name: Install Backend Dependancies 
+        run: ./gradlew downloadDependencies downloadTestDependencies downloadLinters
+      - name: Run Backend Linting 
+        run: ./gradlew lint --continue 
+      - name: Install FrontEnd Dependancies
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Lint Checks 
+        run: npm run lint 
+  component-testing:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Cache NPM packages 
+        uses: actions/cache@v2 
+        with:
+          path: ~/.npm
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-${{ env.cache-name }}-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-build-
+            ${{ runner.os }}-
+      - name: Install Backend Dependancies 
+        run: ./gradlew downloadDependencies downloadTestDependencies downloadLinters
+      - name: Run Backend Tests    
+        run: ./gradlew createConfigs componentTests 
+      - name: Check Backend Coverage 
+        run: ./gradlew jacocoReport

nodes.bodyText: It is overkill to use this method if just waiting for one specific item to load

commit.message: make sure java coverage is generated
Add 2s sleep to wait for dropdown text
Add 5s sleep for new regen links to be updated
Add 5s sleep for new regen links to be updated

nodes.bodyText: Any reason why the component tests and lint check are run on both ubuntu and windows while e2e is only on ubuntu? I thought it should be the other way around
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@
+name: Continuous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Linting 
+        run: ./gradlew lint --continue 
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Lint Checks 
+        run: npm run lint 
+  component-testing:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Tests    
+        run: |
+          ./gradlew createConfigs componentTests 
+          ./gradlew jacocoReport
+      - name: Generate Types 
+        run: ./gradlew generateTypes
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies 
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Frontend Tests 
+        run: npm run coverage 
+      - name: Upload to Codecov 
+        if: matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest' #only upload to codecov on ubuntu VM 
+        run: bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash)
+  E2E-testing:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

nodes.bodyText: Use uiRetryManager instead of hard-coded wait?
Let's exclude chrome for the time being
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,108 @@
+name: Continuous Integration Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master 
+      - release
+jobs:
+  lint:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Linting 
+        run: ./gradlew lint --continue 
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Lint Checks 
+        run: npm run lint 
+  component-testing:
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest]   
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
+    steps:
+      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
+      - name: Set up JDK 1.8
+        uses: actions/setup-java@v1
+        with:
+          java-version: 1.8
+      - name: Cache Gradle packages
+        uses: actions/cache@v2
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ~/.gradle/caches
+            ~/.gradle/wrapper
+          key: ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-${{ hashFiles('**/*.gradle*') }}
+          restore-keys: |
+            ${{ runner.os }}-gradle-
+      - name: Run Backend Tests    
+        run: |
+          ./gradlew createConfigs componentTests 
+          ./gradlew jacocoReport
+      - name: Generate Types 
+        run: ./gradlew generateTypes
+      - name: Install Frontend Dependencies 
+        run: npm ci 
+      - name: Run Frontend Tests 
+        run: npm run coverage 
+      - name: Upload to Codecov 
+        if: matrix.os == 'ubuntu-latest' #only upload to codecov on ubuntu VM 
+        run: bash <(curl -s https://codecov.io/bash)
+  E2E-testing:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      fail-fast: false #ensure both tests run even if one fails
+      matrix:
+        browser: [chrome, firefox]
